summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and FirstBank Puerto Rico regarding a delinquent criminal grand jury subpoena served on the bank on January 3, 2020. The prosecutors are attempting to compel the bank to produce responsive materials and discuss potential court enforcement.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary correspondent from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, communicating with FirstBank to enforce a criminal grand jury subpoena and threatening court action for non-compliance.

events.title: Criminal Grand Jury Subpoena Served on FirstBank
events.description: A criminal grand jury subpoena was served on FirstBank Puerto Rico with a return deadline of January 15, 2020.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: FirstBank Subpoena Deadline Passes
events.description: The deadline for FirstBank to respond to the criminal grand jury subpoena passed without a response, making the bank delinquent.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Follow-up on FirstBank Subpoena
events.description: A prosecutor follows up on the FirstBank subpoena, noting no record of receiving returns and suggesting a call to the bank or moving to compel.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: Ave. Mu√±oz Rivera #1130, Rio Piedras, PR 00927
keyFacts: A criminal grand jury subpoena was served on FirstBank Puerto Rico on January 3, 2020, with a January 15, 2020 deadline.
As of March 1, 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office had not received a response from FirstBank and considered the bank delinquent.
The prosecutors communicated with FirstBank's customer care and legal department, facing initial issues with document submission formats.
The correspondence shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was prepared to seek a court order to compel production from FirstBank.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, indicating FirstBank Puerto Rico was subject to a grand jury subpoena in the investigation.
